title: Create certificates to enable TLS in Vertica
content:
The cdfcert tool creates self-signed certificates, typically used in test environments. You can skip this section if any of the following apply:

  • You are using your own certificate authority to generate certificates.
  • You are following Vertica documentation for version 25.2.x to enable Vertica TLS/SSL authentication.
  • You do not require TLS for Vertica connection.

Create certificate using cdfcert tool for Vertica

Use the cdfcert script and create the required certificates. For more information on cdfcert script, see Create a CA and issue certificates for external resources.

Running this script generates the following three certificates:

  • cdf_ca.crt
  • server.crt
  • server.key

Use the cdf_ca.crt while deploying Operations Platform and for tenant onboarding.

cdfcert cert create <CN> -S <SAN> -S <SAN> -S <SAN> -d .

where, 

<CN>, is the common name of the external resource. For example: Vertica.

<SAN>, the Subject Alternative Name. For example: FQDN or IP of the Vertica cluster.

You have to mention all the Vertica cluster nodes in SubjectAlternativeName. In Vertica, you can only configure a single certificate. You can't have multiple certificates as in one certificate for each node.  The example mentioned in this topic will only generate the CA and a single cdf_ca.crt.

Update certificate in Vertica

To update the configuration, run the dbinit script with the  certificate and key file using the --tlscert and --tlskey options. See Configure the Vertica database and enable TLS for more details.

Verify that TLS is enabled

  • su - <dbadmin>
  • Log on to vsql.

vsql -h <Host name> -U <User name> -p <Port> -d <Database Name>

Example:
vsql -h Myverticahost.net -U dbadmin -p 5433 -d itomdb
SSL connection (cipher: ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384, bits: 256, protocol: TLSv1.2)
itomdb=> select * from tls_configurations;
     name     |  owner  |  certificate  | ca_certificate | cipher_suites |  mode
--------------+---------+---------------+----------------+---------------+---------
server       | dbadmin | server_signed | myrootCA        |               | ENABLE
LDAPLink     | dbadmin |               |                 |               | DISABLE
LDAPAuth     | dbadmin |               |                 |               | DISABLE
data_channel | dbadmin |               |                 |               | DISABLE
(4 rows)

itomdb=>
